form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. McCain introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To eliminate the sunset date for the Choice Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs, to expand eligibility for such program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Permanent Department of Veterans Affairs Choice Card Act of 2015.

section.header: Expansion of Choice Program of Department of Veterans Affairs

paragraph.text: Section 101 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 (Public Law 113–146; 38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsections (q), (r), (s), and (t) as subsections (p), (q), (r), and (s), respectively.
in subsection (i)(2), by striking during the period in which the Secretary is authorized to carry out this section pursuant to subsection (p); and
in subsection (p)(2), as redesignated by paragraph (1)(B), by striking subparagraph (F).

paragraph.text: Subsection (b) of such section is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: A veteran is an eligible veteran for purposes of this section if the veteran is enrolled in the patient enrollment system of the Department of Veterans Affairs established and operated under section 1705 of title 38, United States Code, including any such veteran who has not received hospital care or medical services from the Department and has contacted the Department seeking an initial appointment from the Department for the receipt of such care or services.

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking In the case of an eligible veteran described in subsection (b)(2)(A), the Secretary shall, at the election of the eligible veteran and inserting The Secretary shall, at the election of an eligible veteran; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking described in such subsection and inserting of the Veterans Health Administration;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (f)(1), by striking subsection (b)(1) and inserting subsection (b);
in subsection (g), by striking paragraph (3); and
in subsection (p)(2)(A), as redesignated by subsection (a)(1)(B), by striking , disaggregated by— and all that follows through subsection (b)(2)(D).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to hospital care and medical services furnished under such section on and after the date that is 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
